main event: A ground radar in Las Cruces, New Mexico, observed a bright light moving rapidly in a straight line for 5-6 minutes in July 1957, possibly identified as an aircraft, balloon, or astronomical object.
interesting points: The observation was made on ground radar, indicating the presence of a moving unknown object.
The source was considered unreliable, leading to a casual and rather obscure investigation, resulting in the case being closed.
The command contacted the 68th ACW Squadron, but no further action was contemplated at that level.
A private citizen reported seeing a strange circular object emitting a bluish-white glow and performing unusual maneuvers near Las Cruces, New Mexico, in July 1957.
The observer was unable to obtain any photographs or physical evidence of the strange aerial object.
sighted object: bright light moving rapidly in a straight line, possibly an aircraft, balloon, or astronomical object
